title: Importance of Grip Strength
content: Grip strength is important as it is one of the strongest physical associations with longer life. It serves as a great proxy for overall body strength and muscle mass, as gripping involves not only the muscles of the hand but also those of the arms and shoulder. Grip strength is a very functional form of strength, given our reliance on our hands for countless everyday tasks, and has an outsized impact on our quality of life.

title: Grip Strength and Injury Prevention
content: Grip strength can directly make the difference between a good and a bad outcome in accidents. Having a strong grip gives you a greater chance of catching yourself after losing balance, thus avoiding the downward spiral in health that often follows a bad fall. The better we are at gripping supports, the less likely that a lapse in balance will result in a full-fledged fall and serious injury.

title: Grip Strength Exercises
content: Some of the exercises that can be incorporated into a fitness routine to improve grip strength include finger pull-ups, dumbbell grip, and paused pull-ups.

title: Importance of Grip Training
content: Supplementing with dedicated grip exercises can help ensure you’re getting maximal benefits throughout life and aren’t letting this important element of physical fitness fall under the radar.
